QREM.base_classes.marginals_analyzer_base module

@authors: Filip Maciejewski, Oskar Słowik, Tomek Rybotycki @contact: filip.b.maciejewski@gmail.com

REFERENCES: [0] Filip B. Maciejewski, Zoltán Zimborás, Michał Oszmaniec, “Mitigation of readout noise in near-term quantum devices by classical post-processing based on detector tomography”, Quantum 4, 257 (2020)

[0.5] Filip B. Maciejewski, Flavio Baccari, Zoltán Zimborás, Michał Oszmaniec, “Modeling and mitigation of cross-talk effects in readout noise with applications to the Quantum Approximate Optimization Algorithm”, Quantum 5, 464 (2021).

class QREM.base_classes.marginals_analyzer_base.MarginalsAnalyzerBase(results_dictionary: Dict[str, Dict[str, int]], bitstrings_right_to_left: bool, marginals_dictionary: Optional[Dict[str, Dict[str, numpy.ndarray]]] = None)[source]

Bases: QREM.base_classes.marginals_analyzer_interface.MarginalsAnalyzerInterface

This is base class for all the classes that will operate on marginal probability distributions. Methods of this class allow to calculate marginal distributions from experimental results.

In this class and its children, we use the following convention for:

  1. Generic experimental results:

Parameters

results_dictionary – Nested dictionary with following structure:

results_dictionary[label_of_experiment][bitstring_outcome] = number_of_occurrences

where:

-label_of_experiment is arbitrary label for particular experiment, -bitstring_outcome is label for measurement outcome, -number_of_occurrences is number of times that bitstring_outcome was recorded

Hence top-level key labels particular experiment (one can think about quantum circuit implementation) and its value is another dictionary with results of given experiment in the form of dictionary of measurement outcomes

  1. Results represented as marginal probability distributions:
    param marginals_dictionary

    Nested dictionary with the following structure:

    marginals_dictionary[label_of_experiment][label_of_subset] = marginal_probability_vector

    where:

    -label_of_experiment is the same as in results_dictionary and it labels results from which marginal distributions were calculated -label_of_subset is potentially_stochastic_matrix label for qubits subset for which marginals_dictionary were calculated. We use convention that such label if of the form “q5q8q12…” etc., hence it is bitstring of qubits labels starting from “q”. -marginal_probability_vector marginal distribution stored as vector

compute_all_marginals(subsets_list: List[List[int]], show_progress_bar: Optional[bool] = False) → None[source]

Implements self.compute_marginals for all experimental keys.

Parameters

  • subsets_list – list of subsets_list of qubits for which marginals_dictionary should be calculated

  • show_progress_bar – if True, shows progress bar. Requires “tqdm” package

compute_marginals(experiment_keys: List[str], subsets_list: List[List[int]]) → None[source]

Return dictionary of marginal probability distributions from counts dictionary :param experiment_keys: list of keys that label experiments for which marginals_dictionary should be taken :param subsets_list: list of subsets_list of qubits for which marginals_dictionary should be calculated

get_averaged_marginal_for_subset(subset)[source]
static get_marginal_from_probability_distribution(global_probability_distribution: numpy.ndarray, bits_of_interest: List[int], register_names: Optional[List[str]] = None) → numpy.ndarray[source]

Return marginal distribution from vector of global distribution :param global_probability_distribution: distribution on all bits :param bits_of_interest: bits we are interested in (so we average over other bits)

Assuming that qubits are labeled from 0 to log2(len(global_probability_distribution))

Parameters

register_names – bitstrings register, default is ‘00…00’, ‘000…01’, ‘000…10’, …, etc.

Returns

marginal_distribution : marginal probability distribution

NOTE: we identify bits with qubits in the variables bitstring_names

#TODO FBM: do some speed tests on some details of those solutions

get_marginals(experiment_key: str, subsets_list: List[List[int]]) → Dict[str, Dict[str, numpy.ndarray]][source]
Like self.compute_marginals but first checks if the marginals_dictionary are already computed

and it returns them.

Parameters

  • experiment_key – key that labels experiment from which marginals_dictionary should be taken

  • subsets_list – list of subsets_list of qubits for which marginals_dictionary should be calculated

Returns

marginals_dictionary: dictionary in which KEY is label for experiment, and VALUE is dictionary with KEYS being qubit subset identifiers (in potentially_stochastic_matrix format “q1q5q23” etc.), and VALUES being marginal probability vectors (see __init__ description)

static get_qubit_indices_from_string(qubits_string: str, with_q: Optional[bool] = False)[source]

Return list of qubit indices from the string of the form “q0q1q22q31” :param qubits_string: string which has the form of “q” followed by qubit index :param with_q: specify whether returned indices should be in form of string with letter

Returns

list of qubit indices:

depending on value of parameter “with_q” the mapping will be one of the following: if with_q:

‘q1q5q13’ -> [‘q1’,’q5’,’q13’]

else:

‘q1q5q13’ -> [1,5,13]

NOTE: this function is “dual” to self.get_qubits_key.

static get_qubits_key(list_of_qubits: List[int]) → str[source]
from subset of qubit indices get the string that labels this subset

using convention ‘q5q6q12…’ etc.

Parameters

list_of_qubits – labels of qubits

Returns

string label for qubits

NOTE: this function is “dual” to self.get_qubit_indices_from_string.

@authors: Filip Maciejewski, Oskar Słowik, Tomek Rybotycki @contact: filip.b.maciejewski@gmail.com

class QREM.base_classes.marginals_analyzer_interface.MarginalsAnalyzerInterface[source]

Bases: abc.ABC

This is interface for classes that will analyze marginal probability distributions. It requires those child classes to have basic functionalities that should be included. for analyzing marginals_dictionary.

abstract compute_marginals(experiment_key: str, subsets: List[List[int]]) → dict[source]

Computes marginals_dictionary for input subsets_list of qubits

abstract property marginals_dictionary: dict
abstract marginals_dictionary_update(marginals_dictionary_new: dict) → None[source]
